alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greene; Eastern Ulster; Western Columbia; Western Dutchess (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 2:27PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Ulster, northwestern Dutchess, southwestern Columbia and southeastern Greene Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 227 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Saugerties South, or over Saugerties, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hudson, Catskill, Saugerties, Claverack, Woodstock, Livingston, Clermont, Red Hook, Athens, Lorenz Park, Claverack-Red Mills, Saugerties South, Lake Katrine, Veteran, Germantown, Tivoli, Centerville, Kerleys Corners, Quarryville and Burden Dock. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 20 and 21. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for east central New York.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Greene; Eastern Ulster; Western Columbia; Western Dutchess
